pageSubtitle: Consul is a networking tool that provides comprehensive service discovery and service mesh solutions. It solves networking and security challenges when operating microservices and cloud infrastructure in multi-cloud and hybrid cloud environments at any scale. This documentation describes Consul, provides usage workflows for Consul operations and service networking scenarios, and includes specification and API references to help you build custom automated solutions for your network.

marketingContentBlocks.title: Popular use cases
marketingContentBlocks.description: Consul is a service networking platform with many features for securing your service communications and automating network service management.

cards.title: API Gateway solutions
cards.description: Consul's API gateway enables external network clients to securely access applications and services.

cards.title: Configuration management solutions
cards.description: Consul supports static and dynamic service configurations based on service and node state.

cards.title: Domain Name Service (DNS) solutions
cards.description: Consul provides DNS functions including lookups, alternate domains, and access controls across runtimes and cloud providers.

cards.title: Service discovery solutions
cards.description: Consul's service discovery capabilities help you discover, track, and monitor the health of services within a network.

cards.title: Service mesh solutions
cards.description: Consul's service mesh features help you secure, manage, and observe service-to-service communication within a network.

marketingContentBlocks.title: Supported runtimes and platforms
marketingContentBlocks.description: Consul supports many application runtimes and cloud platforms, and enables service networking in hybrid and multi-cloud environments.

cards.title: Consul on local and virtual machines

marketingContentBlocks.title: Getting started
marketingContentBlocks.description: If you are new to Consul, these resources can help you learn about Consul and quickly get started with its service networking features.

cards.title: Consul fundamentals
cards.description: This documentation sequence summarizes the core knowledge, interactions, configurations, and operations for new Consul users.

cards.title: Get started with Consul on Virtual Machines
cards.description: These tutorials include a GitHub repo and a hosted terminal sessions to help you deploy Consul on VMs and explore its service discovery and service mesh features.

cards.title: Get started with Consul on Kubernetes
cards.description: These tutorials include a GitHub repo help you deploy Consul on a Kubernetes cluster and explore its service discovery and service mesh features.

cards.title: Migrate a monolith with Consul and Nomad
cards.description: These tutorials include a GitHub repo to demonstrate how you can migrate a monolithic application to microservices, integrate it with Consul, run the application on Nomad, and then scale the application automatically.

marketingContentBlocks.title: Consul operations

cards.title: Manage multi-tenancy
cards.description: How to use one Consul datacenter for multiple tenants, with admin partitions, namespaces, network segments, and sameness groups.

cards.title: Manage Consul
cards.description: How to manage and customize Consul's behavior, including DNS forwarding on nodes, server disaster recovery, rate limiting, and best practices for scale.

cards.title: Monitor Consul

cards.title: Upgrade Consul

cards.description: How to use Consul's service discovery features, including Consul DNS, service lookups, load balancing.

cards.title: Connect service mesh
